Class WhistState

  • java.lang.Object
    • WhistState

  • public class WhistState
extends java.lang.Object
    A class implementing an object which represents an agent's view of the current game state of the trick-playing card game, Moss Side Whist. Incorporates the Exhausted Suits Evaluator. (ESE).
    Version:
    5.5
    Author:
    Evan Huang 20916873

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WhistState(java.lang.String curr, java.lang.String left, java.lang.String right)
      Overloaded constructor (default)
      WhistState(java.lang.String curr, java.lang.String left, java.lang.String right, boolean ese)
      WhistState constructor which allows DSE to be set on/off

    • Method Detail

      • cloneAndRandomize

        public WhistState cloneAndRandomize()
        Clone and randomize the current game simulation, changing the hands of the two simulated players, keeping other parameters constant.
        Returns:
        The new randomized gamestate.

      • discard

        public void discard(int player,
                    Card c)
        Discard cards for the given player.
        Parameters:
        player - the player who is discarding cards.
        c - the card to be discarded.

                    int index)

        Parameters:
        player - the player who is discarding cards.
        index - Index of the card to be discarded.

      • doMove

        public void doMove(Card move)
            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Simulate playing a card, given the current game state.
        Parameters:
        move - The card to play.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • getResult

        public int getResult()
              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Run termination evaluation of the current (terminal) game state.
        Returns:
        1 if this agent wins this simulation, else returns 0.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • getSimulationMove

        public Card getSimulationMove()
                       throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Using the default (rollout) policy, choose the next move to play.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • getValidMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<Card> getValidMoves()
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        A method which given the current game state, returns a set of valid moves according to the rules of moss side whist. (i.e. Can only play cards which are in your hand, must play card of same suit, etc.)
        Returns:
        An arrayList of moves which are valid, given the current game state.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • isTerminal

        public boolean isTerminal()
        Checks if the simulated game is in a terminal state.
        Returns:
        true if this game state is terminal, else false.

      • setupDeal

        public void setupDeal(java.util.List<Card> hand,
                      int order)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Method to initialise OR reset variables after being called during dealing stage of the current round.
        Parameters:
        hand - List representing the hand of the current player.
        order - Index of the current player's position relative to the leader. (0 = Leader, 1 = Left, 2 = Right).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • validateScores

        public void validateScores(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> sc)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Validate our own scorekeeping with actual information from the game scoreboard.
        Parameters:

        Throws:
